subject: Photography
title: Rhythm and Repetition
description: A fast breakdown of Rhythm and Repetition for builders.

hook.text: Fence posts receding into the distance. Windows repeating up a skyscraper. Visual rhythm is music for the eyes.

buildup.text: Repetition of visual elements creates rhythm â€” a sense of movement, tempo, and flow within a still image.

discovery.text: Rhythm guides the eye across the frame. Evenly spaced elements create calm rhythm. Varied spacing creates syncopation.

twist.text: Pure repetition can become monotonous. The best rhythm images include a variation â€” a change that adds interest.

climax.text: Architecture, agriculture, and urban design are rich in rhythm. Look for rows, grids, sequences, and progressions.

punchline.text: Rhythm is music you see. Look for the beat.

quiz.question: How does visual rhythm function in a photograph?
options: Repeated elements create a sense of movement and flow guiding the eye
